name: tillandsia
light: Dappled Sunlight (Shade through upper canopy all day)
Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
flower-description: Inflorescence is usually a spike, terminal, with colorful bracts. Flowers are green, white, violet, red, blue, pink, cream, yellow, corolla cylindrical or lobes spreading; bracts red, yellow, pink, blue, green; stamens exserted.
leaf-description: Leaves are simple, bundled, in a rosette or in 2 rows, entire, covered with absorbent gray scales. Various shapes and sizes depending on the species
stem-description: Stem is short, simple; few roots, wiry.
